events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection during heavy traffic.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim promptly.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission and next steps explained.
Request sent for vehicle damage photos, police report, and driver’s license to proceed with investigation.
Customer promptly provided the requested accident photos, police report, and identification documents.
The claim investigator began reviewing submitted documents and contacting witnesses for details.
Investigation confirmed fault and damage estimates; report prepared for settlement decision.
A settlement proposal reflecting fair market repair costs was presented to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement terms offered.
The claim was officially approved for settlement after customer acceptance of repair and payment terms.
Payment for vehicle repairs was issued to the customer’s preferred bank account without delays.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after full payment and customer confirmation of repair completion.
All documents and communications were archived for record-keeping and future reference if necessary.
